com.clarkparsia.openrdf
Interface ExtGraph

All Superinterfaces:
java.util.Collection<Statement>, FunctionalGraph, Graph, IOGraph, java.lang.Iterable<Statement>, java.io.Serializable
public interface ExtGraph
extends IOGraph, FunctionalGraph

Extends the basic Sesame Graph interface to provide more concise access to various utility methods defined in Graphs or other interfaces as well as safer access to some methods that are functionally equivalent to what is defined in GraphUtil; nulls are not returned nor is GraphUtilException thrown for these methods.

Also provides convenient accessors to common RDF & RDFS properties.

Since:
0.8
Version:
0.8
Author:
Michael Grove
See Also:
Graphs, IOGraph, FunctionalGraph

Method Detail

contains

boolean contains(Resource theSubj,
                 URI thePred,
                 Value theObj,
                 Resource... theContexts)

Return whether or the graph contains any statements matching the given SPO and optionally C pattern.

This is functionally equivalent to calling Graph.match(...).hasNext()

Parameters:
theSubj - the subject, or null for wildcard
thePred - the predicate, or null for wildcard
theObj - the object, or null for wildcard
theContexts - optionally, the contexts to check
Returns:
true if the Graph contains at least one statement matching the pattern, false otherwise

getInstancesOf

java.lang.Iterable<Resource> getInstancesOf(URI theType)
Returns all the instances of the specified type

Parameters:
theType - the type for instances to return
Returns:
all instances in the graph rdf:type'd to the given type.

Returns:
all individuals

getObject

com.google.common.base.Optional<Value> getObject(Resource theSubj,
                                                 URI thePred)
Return the value of the property for the given subject. If there are multiple values, only the first value will be returned. Use GraphUtil.getObjectIterator(org.openrdf.model.Graph, org.openrdf.model.Resource, org.openrdf.model.URI, org.openrdf.model.Resource...) if you want all values for the property.

Parameters:
theSubj - the subject
thePred - the property of the subject whose value should be retrieved
Returns:
optionally, the value of the the property for the subject
See Also:
Graphs.getObject(org.openrdf.model.Graph, org.openrdf.model.Resource, org.openrdf.model.URI)

getLiteral

com.google.common.base.Optional<Literal> getLiteral(Resource theSubj,
                                                    URI thePred)
Return the value of of the property as a Literal

Parameters:
theSubj - the resource
thePred - the property whose value is to be retrieved
Returns:
Optionally, the property value as a literal. Value will be absent of the SP does not have an O, or the O is not a literal
See Also:
Graphs.getLiteral(org.openrdf.model.Graph, org.openrdf.model.Resource, org.openrdf.model.URI)

getResource

Return the value of of the property as a Resource

Parameters:
theSubj - the resource
thePred - the property whose value is to be retrieved
Returns:
Optionally, the property value as a Resource. Value will be absent of the SP does not have an O, or the O is not a Resource
See Also:
